intro: Dorstenia tenera var. obtusibracteata, commonly known as the woolly arrowroot, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is native to parts of Central and South America. Its distinctive appearance and adaptability make it a popular choice for indoor gardening and tropical plant collections.
